resources.string: Standard
A rotating format featuring the most recent sets (typically from the last two years). It is the most common format in official tournaments.
Future
Not an official format, but it may refer to experimental playtesting with unreleased cards or mechanics.
Historic
A digital-only format exclusive to MTG Arena. It includes all legal cards in Arena without rotation.
Timeless
A digital format in MTG Arena that allows playing with all available cards on the platform, including Alchemy cards.
Gladiator
A singleton format (one copy per card, except basic lands) exclusive to MTG Arena, featuring 100-card decks without a commander.
Pioneer
A non-rotating format that includes all cards from Return to Ravnica (2012) onward, without Standard restrictions.
Explorer
A digital version of Pioneer in MTG Arena. It only uses cards available on the platform, aiming to expand until it fully matches Pioneer.
Modern
A non-rotating format that includes all cards from Eighth Edition (2003) onward. It is highly popular in tournaments and offers a wide variety of strategies.
Legacy
An eternal format that allows all Magic cards (except banned ones). It has restriction lists but enables powerful combinations.
Pauper
A format where only common cards can be played. It is available both in paper and digital (MTGO and Arena).
Vintage
An eternal format where all cards are legal, including the most powerful ones in Magic\'s history. Some cards are restricted to one copy per deck.
Penny Dreadful
An unofficial MTGO format where only cards priced at 0.01 tix in the digital market can be played.
Commander (EDH)
A casual multiplayer format with 100-card decks and a legendary commander. Only one copy of each card is allowed, except for basic lands.
Oathbreaker
A format similar to Commander, but with a 60-card deck and a "signature spell" associated with the Planeswalker commander.
Standard Brawl
A Brawl variant that only allows Standard-legal cards.
Brawl
A Commander variant with 60-card decks and no multiplayer restrictions. It is played both in paper and on MTG Arena.
Alchemy
A digital format in MTG Arena featuring exclusive and dynamically balanced cards. Similar to Historic but with modified cards.
Pauper Commander (PDH)
A Commander variant where all cards must be commons, except for the commander, which can be an uncommon.
Duel Commander
A competitive 1v1 version of Commander with specific rules and a unique ban list.
Old School
A format featuring only older sets (generally 1993\-1994). Variations exist depending on the specific rules used.
Premodern
A format that allows cards from Fourth Edition to M15 but excludes Modern. Focused on classic strategies.
PreDH
Not a widely recognized format, but it may refer to playing Commander with rules from before certain official changes.
